reviews.review:
Here you will see why I love Half-Life: Blue Shift, but in my review you will read about why I gave it a negative review due to some problems.

I love Half-Life: Blue Shift I love the story behind Barney Callhoun. I love the story from the views of a security guard at Black Mesa and that take.

Now I remember back in 2005 when I first played Half-Life: Blue Shift it had DirectX 8 support and now with VALVe pushing Linux support and removing DirectX 8 from the Gold Source engine video games adding OpenGL support to the Gold Source engine video games I keep getting OpenGL errors every now and then and some freezing issues, which I do not remember ever happening with DirectX 8.

Here is a screenshot of one of the few OpenGL errors I experience here and there. Followed by freezing of the video games that use OpenGL, before crashing.

https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/887417416764768257/926930307003850792/OpenGL_errors_on_video_games_that_use_OpenGL_on_Windows.png

VALVe please add DirectX 8 support or at least a more up to date version of DirectX 9 support which supports 64-bit, which is DirectX 9.0C I believe?

Save game bug again encountered.

Otherwise I cannot give Half-Life: Blue a positive review due to these technical issues, which I cannot seem to fix even if I reinstall Windows or Half-Life: Blue Shift.
cool but its too short
á Œá Œ
Feels more like a fan game

Blue Shift is relatively short but still it covers/adds to the parts that are already seen/present in Half-life and Opposing forces. If medium is too easy try hard mode for a change cause that will make you really plan your moves in this game. If you want to speed run this game probably this is the easiest out of the tree. Over all experience was positive for me.

10/10

super fun game. very creative puzzles and the classic early half life gameplay. I beat it playing 5 hours straight. Could be longer game but well worth every penny! Has great moments and jump scares. Classic! Genius!

I didn't grow up with Half Life but it manages to pull me in more than modern AAA games. Blue shift is great!

I played the very first half-life within a month after its release but for some reason I waited 20+ years to play the second expansion for the game. The nostalgia is strong while playing through Blue Shift. Similar enough to the original game to make me feel like a kid again while different enough to feel "new" in its own right.

Blue Shift es una buena expansiÃ³n para el Half Life original, amplia la historia un poco mÃ¡s, sin embargo tiene algunas cosas negativas "justificadas", en este caso controlamos a un Guardia de Seguridad de Black Mesa y esto justifica un poco la ausencia de muchas de las armas del juego original y solo preservando algunas cuantas que con coherencia podrÃ­a utilizar un Guardia.

La historia es bastante corta incluso mÃ¡s que la expansiÃ³n "Opposing Force", sin embargo, he de rescatar el trabajo en la ambientaciÃ³n, el juego se siente mucho mÃ¡s "terrorÃ­fico" hasta cierto punto, ya que desde un inicio empezamos a transitar por las zonas mÃ¡s inhÃ³spitas del mapa, y sin contacto con aliados, por lo cual junto al sonido da un aire de Suspenso/Incomodidad.

No incluye multijugador, lo cual es razonable ya que no incluye mucho contenido nuevo.

6/10.

This DLC is short but sweet. It has a lot of action and great story. I really enjoyed it. One thing sucked. At start of game there was mouse glitch that made using camera almost impossible. But its easy to fix in settings of the game!

Uma DLC de Half-Life 1 desnecessÃ¡ria e nem um pouco memorÃ¡vel.

PrÃ³s:
- Expande a histÃ³ria do universo HL, mesmo que seja sÃ³ um pouco.
- Primeiro jogo HL que adicionou personagens de alta definiÃ§Ã£o na GoldSrc.

Contras:
- Jogo muito curto. Apenas 3 horas.
- NÃ£o adiciona nenhuma arma, inimigo ou boss novo, em comparaÃ§Ã£o com outra DLC do mesmo jogo, Opposing Force.
- Quase todos os modelos, texturas e mÃºsicas sÃ£o itens reciclados dos jogos anteriores.
- Level design Ã© irritante Ã s vezes. Em alguns momentos, vocÃª perde tempo tentando achar a saÃ­da, botÃ£o ou outra coisa para continuar, mas acaba andando em cÃ­rculos.

Essa DLC parece mais um mod que uma expansÃ£o, mas se vocÃª for um fÃ£ hardcore de Half-Life, Ã© uma experiÃªncia que vale tentar.
best half life expansion pack in my opinion

I played this after playing half life 1 and half life opposing force and i can say its 100% worth it (especially when its on sale and its 79 cents).There are only two problems it has the hd models (you can easily disable them in settings) and a weird mouse problem that is easily fixed too by turning on raw mouse input in settings.

Tive a oportunidade de jogar as duas expansÃµes, Opposing Force e Blue Shift. Blue Shift Ã© a mais curta com em mÃ©dia 2 horas e tambÃ©m a que apresenta a menor dificuldade. [b]REVIEW SOBRE O HALF-LIFE ORIGINAL[/b]

Joguei Half-Life pela primeira vez em 2020, entÃ£o essa review nÃ£o tem muito bias com relaÃ§Ã£o a nostalgia de jogo, mas devo deixar claro que joguei muito Counter-Strike 1.5/1.6 na infÃ¢ncia, que eram inicialmente mods de Half-Life e foram depois desenvolvidos na mesma engine, entÃ£o os grÃ¡ficos e a jogabilidade nÃ£o me eram estranhos ao jogar Half-Life.

Devemos deixar claro tambÃ©m um fato: Half-Life Ã© relativamente feio e datado hoje em dia, mas foi um inovador na Ã¡rea de FPS no tempo de seu lanÃ§amento, criando mecÃ¢nicas e elementos de experiÃªncia do usuÃ¡rio que sÃ£o usados atÃ© hoje, como a movimentaÃ§Ã£o em W, A, S, D, botÃ£o esquerdo pra atirar, etc. AtÃ© mesmo no level design o jogo impressiona pra Ã©poca, com salas secretas que sÃ³ quem prestar atenÃ§Ã£o consegue realmente encontrar e tambÃ©m com puzzles pra avanÃ§ar na histÃ³ria, que nÃ£o eram comuns em jogos de FPS da Ã©poca.

Para quem se importa com a histÃ³ria dos jogos e quer jogar esse jogo pelo valor histÃ³rico, ele definitivamente vale a pena. Ã‰ um jogo difÃ­cil sem necessariamente ser frustrante. Entretanto, se os grÃ¡ficos ou a jogabilidade mais antiga nÃ£o te agradam, hoje em dia existe uma opÃ§Ã£o extra se quiser experimentar a essÃªncia de Half-Life: o jogo chamado Black Mesa, uma reimaginaÃ§Ã£o de Half-Life com permissÃ£o de desenvolvimento da prÃ³pria Valve. Ã‰ preciso informar, entretanto, que Black Mesa nÃ£o possui nem a DLC Blue Shift, nem a Opposing Force.

[b]REVIEW SOBRE A DLC BLUE SHIFT[/b]

Half-Life: Blue Shift Ã© mais do mesmo, mas vocÃª joga com algumas armas diferentes e segue a histÃ³ria de um dos policiais/seguranÃ§as da Black Mesa, no mesmo espaÃ§o de tempo que o jogo original mas com uma perspectiva diferente. Enquanto o original se passa em, aproximadamente, dois dias completos (16 de maio de 200x e 17 de maio de 200x), Blue Shift se passa apenas em um dos dias (16 de maio de 20xx, com o final sendo bem breve na manhÃ£zinha do dia 17).

Ã‰ interessante jogar se vocÃª jogou o original porque coloca em dimensÃ£o os lados diferentes da histÃ³ria e tambÃ©m o quÃ£o absurdo era o protagonista Gordon Freeman em comparaÃ§Ã£o aos outros nesse mesmo universo. AlÃ©m disso, algumas coisas que acontecem no original sÃ£o explicadas em Blue Shift. Mas de novo, Ã© mais do mesmo, se vocÃª nÃ£o gostou do primeiro, evite as DLCs Blue Shift e Opposing Forces.

[b]Half-Life: Blue Shift 7/10 - SATISFATÃ“RIO[/b]

Half-Life: Blue Shift is the shorter of Half-Life's two mission packs, clocking in at around 2.5 hours. While short, it's still worth the price of admission, particularly on sale (at the time of writing, you can grab it for 79p, an absolute steal).

As with Opposing Force, Gearbox manages to pull off an interesting campaign that provides gameplay which feels distinct from the main game. There are fewer scripted sequences than in Opposing Force, but what's here is still entertaining, with some great levels and encounters. Blue Shift also has the distinction of providing a more palatable Xen excursion than what can be found in both OpFor and the original Half-Life (though, that may be partly due to the brevity of it).

Blue Shift has a more fun final scenario than Opposing Force, but its actual ending is a bit more pedestrian than the end of Adrian Shephard's tale, which has kept players wondering about his ultimate fate since the mission pack first released. Maybe it's the fact that we actually know what happened to Barney Calhoun thanks to Half-Life 2, but this ending is less likely to stick with you once the credits roll.

Overall, this is well worth the price of admission as an enjoyable bit of Half-Life history and an engaging, if short, campaign in its own right.
